page.title: 17TRANSPORT IN DUDLEY
page.content: {Public transport}is provided by West Midlands Passenger Transport Executive's blue and cream{buses.}An enlarged bus station is currently being built in the town centre. Dudley has no{railway station}the nearest being Dudley Port, (2 miles away). Dudley station closed about twenty years ago, although freight can still be transported from the Dudley Freightliner Depot. The nearest{ {airport}is Birmingham. Dudley is better served by{canals}which are used by pleasure craft. Two famous canal tunnels run under the town. Because Dudley is built on a hill, transport often has difficulty entering the town when snow has fallen and many people are late for work. A new{road,}the {Black Country Route}has been proposed but this is not popular locally.
